job_title: Child and Family Therapist in Concord, NH
pros: I've worked in several non-profit organizations in 3 different states over my career, and Riverbend is by far one of the best. With the challenging work that we do, it is crucial to have an organization that understands the direct link between how staff are treated and how staff treats their clients. Riverbend achieves this with excellent benefits, generous time off, multiple and frequent opportunities for training and growth, employee incentives, and several staff appreciation events throughout the year. The department that I work in is incredibly supportive and puts a lot of emphasis on keeping morale high - it's honestly fun to go to work, even when the work that we do can be incredibly challenging.
cons: Comparatively to other Community Mental Health Agencies in the state, the pay at Riverbend is higher than what you would expect. However, earning potential is limited - but that is more of an industry-wide issue than a Riverbend issue.

pros: Riverbend is a wonderful place to work.  Every day I see how dedicated and passionate my coworkers are about the work we do, no matter what their position is within the organization. pros: Riverbend gives you the opportunity to do rewarding work with those in need of services. The company offers generous benefits and training opportunities.
